title: Oncology Acupuncture | Ochsner Health
author: Ochsner Health
cleaned_text: What is acupuncture? How does it work? Acupuncture is a therapeutic component of Chinese Medicine that originated over 2,000 years ago. It involves the insertion of thin filiform needles to stimulate certain points on the body to promote your body's natural healing capabilities. In 1996, the FDA classified the acupuncture needle as a medical device. Acupuncture is recognized by the National Institute of Health and the World Health Organization.
